fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding *Labels*, you need to click outside the *Labels* Field in order to save it, if you close the issue before clicking outside the *Labels* Field, the data is not saved, you can reopen the Issue & the Labels are on "edition mode".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access any Issue
 # Add some Labels
 # Close the Issue

h3. Expected Results

The added *Labels* are saved
h3. Actual Results

The *Labels* are still in edition mode, please see the attached video:
[^screencast-jira.atlassian.com-2021.08.05-14_54_30.webm]
h3. Workaround

Is needed to click outside the *Labels* Field (any other part of the Issue) prior to close the Issue to save their data
fields.summary: Labels are not saved unless you click outside the Labels Field

fields.description: Make the Insights feature works when a filter includes more than a specific project only.
fields.summary: Make the Insights feature works when a filter includes more than a specific project only.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira user who is also having an account as servicedesk customer role, may not be able to create tickets using Incoming mail
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Invite a user as a service desk portal customer
 # Also, have the same user account exist as Jira user
 # setup an incoming mail server and a handler
 # send email to the mail server
 # The email may not be converted to a Jira ticket

h3. Expected Results

Jira ticket should be created via email
h3. Actual Results

Jira ticket may not be created via email
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira user who is also having an account as servicedesk customer role, may not be able to create tickets using Incoming mail

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users are unable to create company-managed software projects with a JWM free subscription
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Under Managed subscriptions ensure a JWM Free subscription is present along with a JSW standard subscription.
 # Make sure that there is a JWM project using the "Default software scheme". 
 # Try creating a company-managed software project. Error message on the screen:
{code:java}
For some reason, the magic did not happen. Click Create to try again.
{code}

h3.  
h3. Expected Results

The company-managed software project should be created
h3. Actual Results

The company-managed software project is not created
h3. Workaround

Delete the JWM product from Manage subscriptions
fields.summary: Users are unable to create company-managed software project with a JWM free subscription

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On a date and dateTime type field, the field defaults to 18/02/1993 (and 1 PM for dateTime fields) upon selection. 

Also for dateTime fields, if a date is selected, but not a time, the field won't save anything in that field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a DateTime type custom field to an issue screen
 # Try to select a date and time on the field

h3. Expected Results
* The field defaults to the current date
* For DateTime fields, the field should be saved even without selecting a time, if the date is selected.

h3. Actual Results

* The field defaults to 18/02/1993 (and 13:00 for dateTime fields)
* The dateTime field won't save anything if just a date is selected

 !image-2021-08-05-09-59-18-311.png|thumbnail! 

Screen Recording:  [^Screen Recording 2021-08-05 at 09.59.50.mov] 

h3. Workaround

None at the moment
fields.summary: Date/DateTime field defaults to 18/02/1993 upon selection

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to delete any shared dashboards regardless of the owner. Returning an internal server error:

 !Screen Shot 2021-08-04 at 17.59.20.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a shared dashboard
 # Go to *System > Shared dashboards*
 # Click on the three dots besides a shared dashboard and select *Delete dashboard*

h3. Expected Results
The dashboard is deleted.

h3. Actual Results
An internal server error is displayed:


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to delete shared dashboards

fields.description:
Today, in the current issue view when you expand *Automation - Rule executions* to see what executions have been triggered for the issue, you are presented the automation rule names along with a reference from the time it ran relative to the present. E.g. 20 days, a month ago, etc. If you have multiple automation rules triggering the issue, this can be very cumbersome to associate specific actions to rule executions.

In order to better identify what rule has exactly been triggered for a specific time frame, e.g. a comment from Automation, it would be more effective to see the exact date and time for when the execution has been triggered.
fields.summary: Show complete timestamp for rule executions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing *Original Estimate* and *Remaining Estimate* using Automation rule *(together or the same trigger)*, the value for Original Estimates reverts
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create one automation rule to edit *Original Estimate* and *Remaining Estimate* fields (XML attached).

 *OR*

 Create two automation rules that edits *Original Estimate* and *Remaining Estimate* fields
 # Trigger the rule(s) and check history.

h3. Expected Results

Only one edition for Original Estimate
h3. Actual Results

You see 2 editions on Original Estimate, as below:
 !image-2021-08-04-15-59-00-306.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Use 2 rules and different triggers.
fields.summary: When editing Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate using Automation rule (together or the same trigger), the value for Original Estimates reverts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can edit the name of a status by either clicking on a status while viewing the workflow editor in diagram mode, and then clicking on *Edit*, or by navigating to the global Statuses page at *https://<YOUR_SITE>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewStatuses.jspa*

But currently if you edit the name of a status on the global page, the Step name displayed on the workflow editor (text mode) will remain named after the old status' name:
 !Screen Shot 2021-08-04 at 14.07.35.png|thumbnail! 
* Step name on the *left*
* Notice that the step name remained as *Selected for Development B*, while the status is currently named as *Selected for Development C*

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Navigate to the Statuses global page https://<YOUR_SITE>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewStatuses.jspa
* Click on *Edit* next to a status and change its name
* Access a workflow that uses that status, and check the current Step name

h3. Expected Results

The step name will follow the new name.

h3. Actual Results

The step name remains as the old name.

h3. Workaround

There are two possible workarounds depending on your scenario:
* If you update the status name directly on the workflow editor, the Step name will be updated correctly:
 !Screen Shot 2021-08-04 at 14.05.37.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2021-08-04 at 14.05.43.png|thumbnail! 
** But still, that will not update the Step name on other workflows that are using the very same status
* If you have different workflows using the same status, simply clicking on *Edit* on the status while in a workflow editor, and then clicking on Update (without changing anything) will update the step name of that status. See the recording:  [^Update step name.mp4]
fields.summary: Editing status name on the global Statuses page does not update the Step name on workflows

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The date/Time picker in the Time Tracking field only allowed the 24-hour format to enter although it will display the time in 12-hour format after entering which confusing the users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an Issue (any issue)  and click "Time tracking"
 # Enter the time spent and then pick the date.
 # Then try entering the time in 12-hour format.

h3. Expected Results

Allowed to enter the time using the 12-hour format as it does in the regular Date/Time field.
h3. Actual Results

Jira will make the time completely disappear, converted to random time, or treated the time entered as a 24-hour format.
Please see the screen recording attached.
h3. Workaround

The current workaround is to enter the time using the 24-hour format.
fields.summary: Date/Time picker in Time Tracking field only allowed 24-hour format

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the "Issue fields" condition in automation for Jira in order to check if a multi-line text field value is empty, the condition returns false even if the multi line text field is empty in the Jira issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a multi-line text custom field
 2. Add to the issue view/edit screen
 3. Create an automation rule:
 +Trigger+: Field value changed
 +Condition+: Issue fields condition such that multi-line text custom field created in step 1 is empty
 +Action+: edit the same field to add some text
h3. Expected Results

Since the multi-line text field value is empty in the Jira issue, the "Issue fields" condition should be true for "Field is empty"
h3. Actual Results

The "Issue fields" condition returns false for "Field is empty" even though the multi-line text field value is empty in the Jira issue.
h3. Workaround

Use JQL condition to check if the field is empty instead of "Issue fields" condition
fields.summary: Automation for Jira: Issue fields condition returns false when checking if multi-line text fields are empty even though the field value is empty

fields.description:
Hi there,

I find that a pretty major flaw with our Jira is that you cannot see if someone else is working on a ticket at the same time as you.

We have a large IT team and multiple people can be working the queues at the same time this results in multiple messages being sent to the reporter at the same time on many occasion which can confuse the reporter.

It would be really good if there was a little box above the add note or reply to customer which would tell you if someone else is replying. E.g. Sara is typing.

I have seen this implemented successfully across other helpdesks sometimes with multiple sections which tell you if someone else is looking at the ticket and who that is and if someone is replying to the ticket and who that person is.

It would be a great addition to the system,

Thanks,

Sara
fields.summary: Seeing when someone else is working

fields.description:
Right now when we clone an Epic the child issues will not be copied, even though the options show up on the screen

!image-2021-08-04-09-50-40-837.png!
fields.summary: Right now when we clone an Epic the child issues will not be copied

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to add a group using a long name to a filter subscription, the user gets a 500 error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter in Jira
 # Create a user group including some special characters and with a long name, like "This is the long group name in Jira Cloud that does not work with the Subscription" (>60 characters)
 # Add users to the group
 # Go back to Jira and click the magnifier icon at the left of the screen and click *Filters*
 # Next to the filter's name, click *more(...) > Manage subscriptions*
 # Click the button *Add subscription*
 ## In *Recipients*, select the group *This is the long group name in Jira Cloud that does not work with the Subscription*
 # Click *Subscribe*

h3. Expected Results

The screen shows the group subscribed to the filter
h3. Actual Results

A 500 error is displayed

 !Screenshot 2021-08-04 at 3.52.30 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Since groups cannot be renamed, create a new group with a shorter name, add the users of the problematic group to this new group and use this group for the filter subscription
fields.summary: Groups with lengthly name characters causes 500 errors in the filter subscription

fields.description:
Currently when you utilise the project filters under <your project> > Issues > All Issues as an example, the sort order is pre defined to sort by "Created" date.

If I change the sort order to be by Key as an example, and navigate away from this screen and back, my earlier sort preference is not saved.

As a user, it will be useful to be able to select my sort preference/customise and save it to be used as my personal preference.
fields.summary: Consider User Preference on Project Filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It would be a really good option to move epics along with their entire sub tree including standard and subtask type issues to another Subtree in the project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run a JQL to select Parent tasks and child tasks together.
 # Use Bulk Issue move operation to move all these tickets to another issue types respectively.
 # While adding the current parent as the new parent in the new issue type, we get the following error "Issue that is currently processed in bulk operation cannot be set as new parent issue".

h3. Expected Results

We would want to move the entire Tree structured tasks to another Issue type in a single Go. Currently, we can achieve it by doing the process twice and mapping the respective parents but we want to do that in a single Go.
h3. Actual Results

We get the following error "*Issue that is currently processed in bulk operation cannot be set as new parent issue*".
h3. Workaround

Workaround is to Move the parent issues first and then move the child issues accordingly.
fields.summary: Ability to move standard issue types and subtask in one go to different issue types

fields.description: When an item is opened it is possible to copy a link to it at the top left - see screen shot.  In other products such as TFS/Azure when copying the item it will create a nicely formatted anchor that can easily be pasted into emails, meeting invites, chats, etc.  The way this works in Jira requires two copy/pastes.  It's the small features that improve product adoption!   It should copy out as Story Title Goes Here that way I can paste it.   !image-2021-08-03-14-25-07-677.png!
fields.summary: Copy item URL - format as hyperlink with item story as text

fields.description: It would be awesome if you could use the Rank (system field) on the gadget's configuration.
fields.summary: Use Rank field on gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Completed sprints are suggested when selecting a value for the sprint field under the "Recent Sprints" section.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Step 1. Create a project with Scrum template
 Step 2. Create an issue in the backlog, create a sprint and start the sprint with the created issue
 Step 3. Create another issue in the backlog and populate the sprint field with the sprint created in step 2
 Step 4. Complete the sprint
 Step 5. Create another issue in the backlog and click on the sprint field. The already closed sprint is suggested:

!Screenshot 2021-02-15 at 6.39.12 PM.png|width=344,height=155!

Step 6: Choosing the closed sprint results in an error, however, if the field is cleared, then the closed sprint is no longer seen

!Screenshot 2021-02-15 at 6.39.30 PM.png|width=347,height=104!

h3. Expected Results

Recent sprints dropdown does not suggest sprints that are already closed
h3. Actual Results

Recent sprints dropdown suggests sprints that are already completed
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Completed sprints are suggested under the "Recent sprints" section of the sprint field

fields.description: Currently the gadgets are updated with the changes during the auto refresh every 15 minutes or it will refresh when the refresh button within the gadget is pressed. It would be great to have a feature which will synchronously refresh the gadgets values as soon as the changes happen in the issues.
fields.summary: Gadgets to update immediately with the changes on issues

fields.description:
h4. Summary
There is a page in "Cog wheel > System > Services" that appears to be only relevant to Jira Server. It has no purpose in Jira cloud because users cannot add files to filesystem.

h4. Suggestion
Remove the "Services" page under global system settings in Jira cloud instances.
fields.summary: Remove "Services" page under Jira System settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the *Lookup issues* action, issue data cannot be fetched when the issues are from a team-managed project and your JQL uses a smart value
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule that uses the *Lookup issues* action
 # Focus your JQL to search for issues in a team-managed project with a smart value (eg."Epic Link" in ({{issue.key}}))
 # After the lookup, create a *Log action* to display the issues using the *{\{lookupIssues}}* smart value with any [+supported fields+|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/automation-actions/#Automationactions-Lookupissues] (eg. \{{lookupIssues.key}})

h3. Expected Results

The audit log should show the issue key (or any field used) of all issues fetched from the lookup.

!lookup_classic.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The results are empty.

!lookup_next-gen.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Lookup issues action doesn't work with team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Drag and dropping an attachment onto a full-page issue doesn’t work if you transitioned to this issue. It is also reported that it sometimes doesn’t work on an initial issue load but this hasn’t been reproduced.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a full page issue that has a sub task.
 # If you drag an attachment onto the issue you’ll see the overlay prompting that it can be added this way.
 # Transition to a sub task.
 # If you drag an attachment onto the issue you will no longer see the overlay prompt, and attempting to attach this way will open the new attachment in a new tab instead.

Note this can also be reproduced with other forms of transition, like transitioning to a parent task via the breadcrumbs.
h3. Expected Results

The file that has been dragged onto the browser is attached to the issue and appears in the attachment film strip.
h3. Actual Results

The file opens in a new tab in the browser.
h3. Workaround

A refresh will fix the problem the vast majority of the time, although there have been reports that on an initial issue load a file cannot be attached via drag and drop. You can also click the 'Attach' button beneath the issue Summary.
fields.summary: Attempting to attach a file to an Issue via Drag and Drop Doesn't Always Work

fields.description:
*Problem definition*
 * Currently, if you are a Jira Administrator your role as complete access to the Default configurations for every project either company or team managed

*Impact*
 * Some administrators can change inadvertently some configurations and break some projects workflows, etc…

*Suggested resolution*
 * Add the possibility to allow a more granular role-based permission model to allow the lockdown of some features/configurations for particular users with Admin Role in Jira.
fields.summary: Granular permissions for Admins

fields.description:
When adding people to projects - assigning project role to person, it would be great if you could assign a role to a whole team (People and Teams).

Currently, it's only possible to assign a role to a specific person or defined user group.
fields.summary: Ability to add team(s) to projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The JQL links on an 'Average Time in Status' chart don't use time zones correctly. For example, viewing the chart now, in Australia/Sydney _should_ have a most recent bucket with a lower bound of {{"2021-08-02 13:00"}}, but instead produces a query of:

{{updated >= "2021-08-02 23:00" AND updated <= "2021-08-02 23:59" ORDER BY created DESC}}

That looks like it's applying the timezone offset in the wrong direction.

This may not be an issue with coarser time periods.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an 'Average Time in Status' gadget with a period of 'Hourly'
 # Look at the the link for the most recent bucket 

h3. Expected Results

The most recent bucket matches local current time.
h3. Actual Results

The bucket is offset from current local time.
h3. Workaround

Use a coarser period.
fields.summary: Average Time in Status JQL links use the wrong time with hour resolution

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some multi-byte characters get garbled when configuring dashboard gadgets.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dashboard
 # Add an activity stream gadget
 # Click *...* > *configure* and edit the title using Japanese (e.g. テスト TEST)
 # Click "Save" button
 # Click *...* > *configure* again

h3. Expected Results
"テスト TEST" appears in the title.

h3. Actual Results
Garbled characters such as "ãã¹ã TEST" appears in the title.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Some multi-byte characters get garbled when configuring dashboard gadgets.

fields.description:
In our work process, we ask the developers to create a card on trello so it will be easy for tech leads to manage them easily. 

I want to automate this part of the workflow but I can't find a way. 

I need to create a card on trello when specific Jira issue is marked as in progress & it has a pull request linked to it.
fields.summary: Ability to create trello cards based on jira issues statuses in Automation rules.

fields.description: Provide the ability to move to the trash service management projects.
fields.summary: Service Management Project Trash

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Assignee list is incomplete unless you search for *. In some issues, the list works as soon as you click assignee but in others you need to search for *
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an issue > Change the assignee

h3. Expected Results
The list of assignable users
h3. Actual Results
A limit list with 2 or 3 users until you search for *

h3. Workaround
Search for * to get the full list of users.
fields.summary: Assignee list incomplete unless you search for *

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When users access Jira Cloud through a mobile browser (not app), they are prompted to go into a mobile version of the site.

This version shows a responsive issue view, but when the user tries to transition the issue and there is a transition screen, the dialog appears with the legacy code, rather than the new responsive view, so users can't navigate through it to change selectors, zoom out, or click buttons.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a smartphone or similar device, access an issue, and when prompted to use the web mobile version, proceed with it.
# Click on the status selector to perform a transition that contains a transition screen.

h3. Expected Results
A dialog is open and responsive to the device's screen size.

h3. Actual Results
The dialog opens but does not fit the screen, or allows to zoom out, it's not possible to edit the fields, or click to submit the transition.

 !image-2021-07-30-16-58-11-879.png|thumbnail!  !image-2021-07-30-16-58-28-104.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
You can still use the Jira Cloud mobile app, or open the issue on the desktop browser to perform the transition.
fields.summary: Transition screens are broken on the mobile web issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

While the REST API can be used to change some project settings, the section within Project settings called Features does not appear to have any way to change those settings via the REST API inside of company managed projects
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be helpful if there was a way for project administrators and related apps with permission to be able to see and possibly change the Project Settings > Features settings using a REST API endpoint
h3. Why this is important

Currently the only way to set or change Features of a project are within the web UI. It would be helpful to be able to change these via REST API for the sake of numerous integrations that might depend on specific features being enabled/disabled to provide functionality.
h3. Workaround

(Optional)
fields.summary: In Company Managed projects, I want to be able to see and set Project settings > Features using the REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira search API endpoint (/rest/api/2/search) does not include custom field values in the API response while using the "startAt" query parameter
 * This behaviour affects export of jira issues via native CSV option or via add-ons such as "Jira cloud for Excel" or "Jira Cloud for Sheets" where in the exported file shows blank field values for some issues even though the field value exists in Jira.

 * For some values of "startAt" parameter, we see that the exported issue field values are populated, however, we see empty field value responses for some. For example, if "startAt" parameter is set to 400, none of the issues have the custom field value returned in the response. However, it works for 200, 300, 500 or any other number but not for 400.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Perform a search via endpoint /rest/api/2/search and change the startAt parameter:
 +_Example:_+
{code:java}
/rest/api/2/search?jql=ORDER%20BY%20summary%20ASC&fields=customfield_10020&maxResults=100&startAt=400{code}

h3. Expected Results

The custom field values (if populated) should be returned in the search API response
h3. Actual Results

The search API response does not include the field values as expected for some "startAt" parameters.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira search API endpoint (/rest/api/2/search) does not include custom field values in the API response while using the "startAt" query parameter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to change the project Key in a project that has a huge number of tickets, it is timing out.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Project with more than 40k tickets (as seen in customer environment).
 # Change the Project Key.

h3. Expected Results
Project Key changes successfully.

h3. Actual Results
Results in a 500 Error. 
!image-2021-07-30-17-10-38-233.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:

{code:java}
message: [Limited to 100 per PT1M] Encountered exception while executing OLD code behind Rollout Flag [monolith.crud.take.issue.locks.in.order]. Exception will be propagated up the stack.

err.msg: Caught PSQLException for update "public"."jiraissue" "ISSUE"
set "pkey" = ?
where "ISSUE"."project" = ?

err.stack: com.querydsl.core.QueryException: Caught PSQLException for update "public"."jiraissue" "ISSUE"
set "pkey" = ?
where "ISSUE"."project" = ?
	at com.querydsl.sql.DefaultSQLExceptionTranslator.translate(DefaultSQLExceptionTranslator.java:50)
	at com.querydsl.sql.Configuration.translate(Configuration.java:508)
	at com.querydsl.sql.dml.AbstractSQLUpdateClause.execute(AbstractSQLUpdateClause.java:221)
....
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: canceling statement due to statement timeout
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2532)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResults(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2267)

{code}


h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changing Project Key resulting in 500 Error.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Assignee is not notified about issue creation when a post-function to change assignee is incorrectly placed on workflow.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Update the workflow in order to have the same post-functions during issue creation
#* !Screenshot 2021-07-23 at 17.43.56.png|thumbnail!
# Create an issue and choose an assignee on create screen

h3. Expected Results
The assignee is notified

h3. Actual Results
The assignee on workflow is not added to issue and the one selected on create screen is not notified.

h3. Workaround
Remove the post function or move the post function to first row (so the assignee added is the one on workflow).
fields.summary: Assignee is not notified about issue creation

fields.description: Similar request as https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-76684: for JWM it would be helpful to be able to add Insight fields as columns. But customfields are just as important.
fields.summary: JWM: Add support for Insight fields to List-View

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, there is no option to set up a notification/alert for a user or group that a bulk operation has been performed. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # The user performs a bulk update
 # Notifications are sent on issue-level
 # Cannot set a notification/alert to a specific user or group like site-admins to be notified that a bulk operation has been performed

h3. Proposed solution

Add an option for Jira administrators to set up a notification/alert to a user or group in case of a bulk operation.
fields.summary: Notification event for bulk operations

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment , both rest API call doesn't have [pagination|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/intro/#expansion] format. Due to that, the admin will not know if the results are on the last page.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add pagination for both rest API request .

h3. Why this is important
Easier for admin to know whether they already retrieve all data , which means already in the last page of the results.

h3. Workaround 
Manually check the result number based on the maxResults value. If it less than the maxResults value , it already on the last page.
fields.summary: Add pagination for /rest/api/3/users/search and /rest/api/3/users API
JQL query for date time fields (e.g. created, updated) should show hidden 00:00 timestamp on search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Project widget not displaying HTML description details
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add description information to the Details field of the Project including bullets, bold style or any other HTML/rich text option
# View the Project in the Projects widget
h3. Expected Results
Project widget should display the correct rich text/HTML selected
h3. Actual Results
Project widget displays the HTML tags in coding:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Project widget not displaying HTML description details

fields.description: It would be beneficial to see what rules are using project roles as part of the View Usage page.
fields.summary: Add usage in automation rules to View Usage page for Project Roles

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
You cannot add external users to a classic project if you do not have access to the project itself. The error depends on the project type you used.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a user that does not exist on the site yet
# Restrict your access to the project by removing 'Browse Projects'
# Go to the 'People' section of the project then add the external user

h3. Expected Results
We expect that the external user will be invited to the site receiving an invitation email. 

h3. Actual Results
You will get an error 'something went wrong project no found' for a business project and '1 Invite not sent We couldn’t invite abc@abc.com' for a software project.

Error for business project:
 !Screenshot 2021-07-29 at 16.30.12.png|thumbnail! 

Error for a software project:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the network tab in the browser:

{code}
HEADER:
Request URL: 
https://tesaonline.atlassian.net/rest/internal/2/invite-user/project/11180
Request Method: 
POST
Status Code: 
404

PREVIEW:
{errorMessages: ["Project not found"], errors: {}}
	errorMessages: ["Project not found"]
		0: "Project not found"
	errors: {}

RESPONSE:
{"errorMessages":["Project not found"],"errors":{}}
{code}

h3. Workaround
# Grant yourself access to the project before inviting the external user
OR
# Invite the user to the site through user management before adding them to the project
fields.summary: Cannot add external users to classic projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, there are no actions that allow you to update the *Rank* field of Jira issues, particularly to send an issue to the top on Backlogs or Sprints.

h3. Proposed solution

A new action should be added to "Send to top" so that an issue can be ranked to the top of the list.
fields.summary: Action to rank issues to the top

fields.description: At the moment it is not possible to make any field as *Required* in the Team managed projects.
fields.summary: Ability to make fields Required in the Team Managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When logging time against a Jira issue the date and time selectors do not respect the user's language settings when in English (UK) mode, and instead show US time and date formatting.

While this bug report specifically references US and UK English, we do also need to validate that other languages are displaying properly before closing this bug.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure language preferences for the current user is set to 'English (UK)' 
# Click 'Log Work' on a jira issue
 # Enter time spent (e.g. 2h)
# Expand the date and time picker to select when the time was logged

h3. Expected Results
Date format should be dd/mm/yyyy and time format should be 24 hour

h3. Actual Results
Date format is mm/dd/yyyy and time format is 12 hour with AM/PM

 !image-2021-07-29-15-19-59-100.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Time tracking does not use locale settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Both the attachment cards, and attachment list does not show the correct date and time formatting per language settings.

While this bug report specifically references US and UK English, we do also need to validate that other languages are displaying properly before closing this bug.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach a file to a Jira ticket
 # Set user profile language to be 'English (UK)
 # View list of attachments, or attachment strip view

h3. Expected Results

Time listed on attachment should be in 24 hour format and date should be arranged 
h3. Actual Results

Time listed is in 12 hour format with AM/PM

!image-2021-07-29-15-06-05-943.png!
!image-2021-07-29-15-07-37-324.png!

h3. Workaround

No known workaround
fields.summary: Attachment list in issue view does not show correctly formatted date and time per language settings

fields.description: At the moment it is not possible to make a field Read-Only in Team managed projects.
fields.summary: Ability to create Read Only field in Team managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when webhook endpoints are setup, we cannot check if a webhook delivery failed via UI. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add visibility to failed webhook delivery logs via UI. 

h3. Why this is important
This is important because non-technical users/owners of the webhooks do not have easy access when webhook delivery failed.
 
h3. Workaround 
The workaround is to create a Connect App that would register the webhook and periodically check the _failed webhook_ queue via this [GET API command|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-webhooks/#api-rest-api-3-webhook-failed-get].
fields.summary: Add visibility to failed webhook delivery logs via UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the *Field should be modified during the transition* Validator on the *Create* Transition, it always displays the configured error when creating an Issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the *Field should be modified during the transition* Validator on the *Create* Transition of your Workflow
 # Publish the Draft
 # Try to create an Issue from the modified Workflow

h3. Expected Results

Create the Issue when the Field value is modified
h3. Actual Results

The error configured when setting up the *Field should be modified during the transition* Validator 
h3. Workaround

Use the *Field Required Validator* instead of the *Field should be modified during the transition* Validator
fields.summary: Field should be modified during the transition Validator is not working when is added on the Create transition

fields.description:
Currently the *issues in this epic* section of epics can only be sorted by the fields created, key, priority, status and assignee:

 !Screen Shot 2021-07-28 at 18.24.36.png|thumbnail! 

Users could benefit from more sorting options for fields visible in this panel, such as issue type or summary.
fields.summary: Add more fields to sort the 'issues in this epic' panel

fields.description: Currently, only company-managed projects through the permission scheme can be shared with the public but team-managed not, it could be useful to have this feature to share for example dashboards with anonymous users.
fields.summary: Make possible to share team-managed projects publicly

fields.description: Availability to collapse Description field
fields.summary: Availability to collapse Description field

fields.description:
When I put an external URL into a ticket description, comment, etc. it creates a link preview (which I'm told are called smart links) and I don't see a way for it to show the page URL instead. We always want the page URL to show. The way it is happening now is very cumbersome. Is there a way to disable this?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Disable Smart Links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Drop-down list for Columns in the Advanced Search screen does not show all available options
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Advanced search screen
 # Open the List view and select the drop-down columns options to try and select an existing column

h3. Expected Results
Should show all available options when scrolling
h3. Actual Results
It gets cut-off at some point and to view all available options you need to search for it, but if you do not know the option you will not be able to search for it

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Drop-down list for Columns in the Advanced Search screen does not show all available options

fields.description:
When choosing an assignee, pressing TAB should select the highlighted option. 

 

The HOME and END keys, as well as SHIFT+HOME and SHIFT+END do not work when trying to clear the text in the field.
fields.summary: The Assigned To field does not respect keyboard users

fields.description:
Currently, we are able to set transition properties as described here: [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-workflow-transition-properties/]

However, we don't have the same methods for Status properties as we can se here: [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-workflow-statuses/#api-group-workflow-statuses]

It would be useful to be able to set statuses properties using REST API as well.
fields.summary: Ability to edit Workflow Status Property using REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

No Email notifications are sent when a web link is added to an issue
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Add a Weblink to an issue where you would receive notification for issue updated event.

h3. Expected Results

Receive a notification for the added link to the Jira Issue.
h3. Actual Results

We do not receive an email notification when a Web link is added to a Jira Issue. 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding a web link to a Jira issue does not trigger a email notification

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Calling the project workflow schemes endpoint intermittently results in undefined being returned as the workflow scheme ID. This was raised in response to https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/calling-get-workflow-schemes-api-sometimes-returns-undefined-instead-of-an-id/50328.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Call /rest/api/2/workflowscheme/project
 # Observe the value of values.0.workflowScheme.id

h3. Expected Results

The value at step 2 always identified a valid workflow scheme ID.
h3. Actual Results

The value at step 2 is intermittently undefined. 
h3. Workaround

Call the endpoint again until a valid workflow scheme ID is returned.
fields.summary: Calling the project workflow schemes endpoint intermittently results in undefined workflow scheme IDs

fields.description:
*Current behavior:*

Pressing dot and typing 'crea....' gives only one suggestion of creating subtask in the New Issue View of an issue:

!image-2021-07-28-13-04-21-097.png|width=810,height=377!

*Expected behavior:*

It should give more suggestions as it gives for the Old Issue View for the same issue:

!image-2021-07-28-13-05-46-853.png|width=810,height=256!
fields.summary: Dot shortcut on New Issue View should have more suggestions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

*Affected features (verified with Chrome 92.0.4515.107):*
 # +Rule deletion+ does not work in Chrome because the confirmation dialog is not appearing
 # +Discarding a new rule mid create+ does not work in Chrome because the confirmation dialog is not appearing
 # +Discarding a new rule created from a template+ does not work in Chrome because the confirmation dialog is not appearing
 # +Reverting rule changes+ does not work in Chrome because the confirmation dialog is not appearing

This problem is caused by [https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5148698084376576].
h3. Steps to Reproduce
h3. Expected Results

A confirmation dialog is displayed and user is able to proceed or cancel.
h3. Actual Results

Confirmation dialog is not displayed

 

Workaround
 # Use Firefox. This bug only affects the *latest* version of Chrome.
 # Use an older version of Chrome. This bug only affects the *latest* version of Chrome.
 # For problems 2, 3, and 4 refreshing the page will also do the trick.
fields.summary: Confirmation dialog is not shown in the latest version of Chrome

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Basic Search does not show available options when Context is used for "Select List (cascading)" custom field
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a custom field of type "Select List (cascading)", for example: "Product category"
# enter cascading options on both level one and level two options
# associate the new field with a project
# add context for issue type "Task" only
# on your selected project, add cascading values to some of your Task issues under this project
# go to Filters > Advanced Issue Search and select:
* your project, issue type: Task, More > "Product category"

h3. Expected Results
A drop down will be available giving you the option to select a value from Cascade level 1, then Cascade level 2

h3. Actual Results
A drop down is showing, giving you the option to only select "Any":
 !image-2021-07-28-16-40-35-365.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Remove related context (issue type/projects) if applicable 
* Or, use the Advanced issue search to select related values
fields.summary: Basic Search does not show available options when Context is used for Cascading custom field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It will be great to have an 'Implement' step in the default 'Problem Management' workflow, that comes with the ITSM project template.

On the current workflow, the 'Under Investigation' status goes directly to 'Closed' or 'Canceled' -- without a step in the middle where the remediation action is implemented

 !problem.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Have an 'Implement' step on the default 'Problem Management' workflow in the ITSM project template

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue Subscription email notification does not display the embedded images in the field
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter subscription 
 # Add a field that has got an image in it
 # Run the subscription to send the email notification

h3. Expected Results

To see the images in the email notification.
h3. Actual Results

Cant display the image.
h3. Workaround

No workaround
h3. Explanation

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-cloud-comments-email-notification-does-not-render-thumbnails-779160845.html]
fields.summary: Issue Subscription email notification does not display the embedded images in the field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the new issue view on a board, it is not possible to move an issue to the same status it is currently in.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud
* Kanban board

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project with Kanban board ;
# Configure its workflow to be able to move an issue to any status;
# Open the issue through the new issue view on the board and move it to the same status it is currently in;

h3. Expected Results
The issue is moved to the same status and any screens related to it are called.

h3. Actual Results
The status is not available on the list to be chosen.
 
h3. Notes
It is possible to move the issue to the same status through the issue detail view using the *workflow* > _status_ 

h3.Workaround
Move issue using the detailed issue view.
fields.summary: Not possible to transit issue to the same status on new issue view

fields.description:
As seen in this image when clicking into a card you can get a summary of progress of the stories or tasks , but if you want to see this metric on the card view Kanban board there is no drop down to select to show this.

!image-2021-07-27-20-21-16-144.png!

!image-2021-07-27-20-25-22-619.png!
fields.summary: Show progress summary in the Kanban card view

fields.description:
Feature - Implementation of moving up and down the validations I have in a transition (like post-function already do).

Currently if validations are defined keeping in mind some specific priority of checks, the error message in the first (or rather, new added) validator should not show up before the ones listed as the most important one.
fields.summary: Ability to move the validators up and down in turn ensuring which error message should show up first

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a user is removed from a Jira site, their display name is still visible for the other users if they query the /rest/api/3/users endooint

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Invite a user to a Jira site
 # Remove that user from the site

h3. Expected Results
The user's personal information (display name) should not be returned anymore, since the user is no longer part of the site

h3. Actual Results
The display name is still return.

This is an issue because anyone in a Jira site (that has the _browse users and groups_ permission) can see the names of anyone that have ever been in that particular site

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Display name of a deleted user is still visible via REST API

fields.description:
Hello! I have a Transition to Resolved screen scheme that requires our team to input two custom fields when transitioning any issue to Closed status. Our team heavily uses Slack to manage Jira workload, and it would be great if I could edit the fields available within Slack's pop-up window to allow the transition to Closed status from Slack directly. Is this possible, and if so, where can I find information on this?

Ex: I navigate to an issue in a Slack thread, I click "Transition" and then change the *Status* to "Close". Then, I click the _Save_ button, and receive an error message in the channel that says  "!https://a.slack-edge.com/production-standard-emoji-assets/13.0/apple-medium/1f6ab.png! Oh no! This project has required fields for the {{Close}} status. Please transition this issue from Jira."

I'd love to be able to just close tasks directly in Slack. Thanks so much!
fields.summary: Ability to transition tasks to Closed via Slack while using custom fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Running a JQL with the function *projectsLeadByUser()* returns an error (status 400 in browser console) if one of the projects is Archived:
{code}
A value provided by the function 'projectsLeadByUser' is invalid for the field 'project'.
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project
 # Add issues to it
 # Ensure you are the Project lead
 # Move the project to Archived
 # Run a JQL with the same user like:
{code}
project in projectsLeadByUser()
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The project should not be returned in the results as it's in the Archived and content is inaccessible, however, this shouldn't prevent other project's content to be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
Error is displayed:
{code}
A value provided by the function 'projectsLeadByUser' is invalid for the field 'project'.
{code}

h3. Workaround
* Restore all the projects you are the lead of from the Archived projects to be able to perform the search, but please keep in mind that this will make the project accessible according to the permission scheme associated with it.
* Alternatively, you can have a dummy user to set as project lead to projects to be marked as archived, but not sure if this would be a feasible option to everyone.
fields.summary: JQL with projectsLeadByUser() returns an error if one of the projects is Archived

fields.description:
For performance and UI reasons, we restricted the use of the ELSE/IF block to the main 'trunk' of the rule (i.e not on branches)

However, it may be holding some customers back. For example, if they want to do some logic for linked issues and with various teams etc.
fields.summary: Allow IF/ELSE block within branches

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Team-managed projects and `status WAS` JQL don't work together.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 2 team-managed projects
 # Create an issue in each project
 # Close each issue
 # Search via JQL: `project IN (projectA, projectB) AND status WAS Closed`

h3. Expected Results

One of:
 # both issues are found
 # or JQL autocompletion suggests project-specific statuses for `status WAS`

h3. Actual Results

Not all issues are found and JQL autcomplete suggests only one value for `status WAS`.
h3. Workaround

Replace status name with [status id|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-projects/#api-rest-api-3-project-projectidorkey-statuses-get].
fields.summary: Searching by statuses of team-managed projects doesn't find issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Setting Issue Security level on a ticket add the history entry in which its being removed
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set a security issue level
 # check history

h3. Expected Results
We expect for the history entry to be correct and show the value being added
h3. Actual Results
history entry shows the value being removed.


h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Setting Issue Security level on a ticket add the history entry in which its being removed

fields.description: as a user, I would like to add more than 55 options in the dropdown list customs field, currently, the field only allows you to add 55 options.
fields.summary: ability to add more than 55 options in the dropdown list custom field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In New Issue View, even if we remove the “Assignee” field from “Edit Screen”, users having “Assign Issue” permission are able to change the Assignee.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Remove "Assignee" from the "Edit Screen"
 # Associate "Assign Issue" project permission with "Any Logged-in users"

h3. Expected Results
No user should be allowed to edit the Assignee field.

h3. Actual Results
Any user who is logged in to the instance is able to edit Assignee

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to make "Assignee" non-editable in NewIssueView

fields.description: Define a feature, where we can create a global variable that can be used within automation rules. This way, we can be able to call this variable into multiple rules and easily change it as well.
fields.summary: As a user I want to define a global variable that can be used in automation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Standard Jira notification emails (e.g. Issue Assigned, Issue Commented, etc.) include a "reply-to" header in the email when the project has its own email address (e.g. in a Jira Service Management project), so that the email recipient can reply to the email and the reply will be added as a comment to the issue.

Unfortunately, emails sent by the
{{POST /rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/notify}}
endpoint do _not_ include the reply-to header, which means replies to the email won't be processed by the email handler. This needs to be fixed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send a Jira notification E-mail with a "reply-to" header when the project has its own email address using a given POST request.

h3. Expected Results

Email handler processes replies to a POST request
h3. Actual Results

Email handler doesn't process replies to a POST request.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: POST /rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/notify doesn't add "reply-to" header

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When a transition screen is involved with an issue and when using Jira cloud app with  IOS,

Instead of the transition screen only a message "A comment is required"  is displayed on the IOS screen and there isn't anywhere to add the comment on the transition.

.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create a screen with a field ( ex: comments)
 Use this screen for a transition in the workflow.
 Install Jira cloud app in IOS
 Access any issue which has a screen during a transition in an IOS device
 When you transition from IOS, instead of the screen, only the message appears- ( comment is required), but no transition screen for inputting the comment.
h3. Expected Results

A transition screen should appear with an input for comments
h3. Actual Results

Only a message is returned it says "A comment is required" and there isn't anywhere to add the comment on the transition.
h3. Workaround

_(Add a workaround, if available)_
h3. Notes
fields.summary: IOS does not show the transition screen

fields.description: I need resize manually the img I paste in editor(Description & Comments) every time. Could this be a setting so that editor can resize imgs following my setting(fixed width & height)?
fields.summary: Image size setting of rich content editor content

fields.description: In cases where two JIRA instances are linked together, you can search an issue from JIRA A to JIRA B (vice versa) and create a link from there. However, it is not possible to search a filter from one instance to another. It would be great to have this feature.
fields.summary: Ability to see a Filter from other linked Instances

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using "Sort: by total" and "Statistic Type: Issue Type" on the Issue Statistics gadget doesn't group up the same type on Team-Managed projects. Using "Sort by: Natural"correctly group up issues.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter that includes at least:
 ## 1 (or more) Team-managed project and 1 (or more) Company-Managed Project
 OR
 ## 2 (or more) Team Managed Projects
 # Create a Dashboard add Issue Statistics gadget
 # Configure it:
 ## Use the created filter.
 ## "Statistic Type: Issue Type"
 ## "Sort by: Natural".
 # Notice the grouping. 
 # Change the filter to "Sort: by total"
 # Now each Team-Managed project will be in one row

h3. Expected Results

It should group on both Sort methods
h3. Actual Results

1 row for each TM project

!image-2021-07-23-16-48-40-002.png|thumbnail!

!image-2021-07-23-16-49-25-018.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Use Sort by Natural instead.
fields.summary: Using "Sort: by total" and "Statistic Type: Issue Type"  on Issue Statistics gadget doesn't group up same type on Team-Managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently the System Webhooks don't allow custom header in the configurations, differently from the automation webhook.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add to the System Webhook configuration the ability to set custom headers.
h3. Why This Is Important

It can help external systems to triage and validate messages coming from the webhooks. Also enable the possibility to authenticate in the external system.
h3. Workaround

Use Send web request in Automation since it allows custom headers.

Another possible workaround is to send the headers as params in the URL, but then the external must allow and handle it properly.
fields.summary: Allow to set custom header in System Webhooks

fields.description:
h3. Problem

As per [Retry policy:|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/webhooks/#retry-policy]
{quote}If a webhook is sent to its callback URL but fails, Jira Cloud will attempt to resend it up to five times. Each subsequent attempt is delayed with a randomized exponential back-off algorithm. The first retry occurs after at least 10 seconds, and the last between 15 and 30 minutes from the first failure.
{quote}
Having that said, It's currently not possible to disable retries or specify how many retries.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add to the Webhook configuration the ability to manually enable, disable and specify how many retries the webhook will perform.
h3. Why This Is Important

It's important to reduce the amount of retry messages in the external system
h3. Workaround

Use X-Atlassian-Webhook-Retry in header to identify retry requests and skip them.
fields.summary: Allow to enable/disable/specify the number of Webhook retries

fields.description:
Jira seems to assume because I am a new user at the company I work at, I'm a new Jira user altogether.

Please provide an option to ignore/avoid "new user" tours. And stop making them mandatory to do my damn job.

Atlassian customers do not care how much you love your work; we have our own products and todos to focus on. I don't need training from a designer who needed some extra points in the sprint.
fields.summary: New to this company I work at, not Jira

fields.description:
As a QA engineer, when I paste a link into a ticket, 99.9% of the time I need the URL to show unfurled so that the engineer can see the location of the issue without actually clicking the link. 

Assuming it was added because people asked for it, please allow a user to configure their preference on this so that if I want the link to always show unfurled we don't have to waste time clicking to change it.
fields.summary: URLs: Allow the user to configure their preference on the URL decorating.

fields.description:
Hi team,

Currently, on the new issue view, it is only available the ability to transition issues across statuses using this dropdown:
 !image-2021-07-23-10-49-25-621.png|width=222,height=186!

It would be nice to have the ability to have the transitions displayed as buttons again on the new issue view:
 !image-2021-07-23-10-51-19-044.png|width=427,height=68!

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Ability to have transition button on the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Enable multiple Statuses in Scrum Backlog
h4. Goal

The goal is that I would like to have full control over the issue statuses appear on the Scrum board and the issues appear in the first "To Do" column of the Scrum board.

Therefore, I would like to be able to hide statuses from a Scrum board and only see issues corresponding to those statuses in the backlog similar to the Kanban backlog column. Advanced roadmaps based on such a Scrum board should still be able to pick up these issues!
h4. Example

In the example below the goal would be to display issues in the first To Do column which are in the Specified status. However, Specified is not the first status in the workflow. Currently there is no proper way to hide issues from the Scrum board in statuses prior the one assigned to the To Do column. If one doesn't want to show issue statuses on a Scrum board (JQL based) and therefore makes these statuses Unmapped on the board the corresponding issues will disappear from the corresponding Backlog and future sprints as well.

!image-2021-07-23-14-12-53-653.png!

 

 

!image-2021-07-23-14-13-33-494.png!
fields.summary: Enable multiple Statuses in Scrum Backlog

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It will be great to add 'Team', 'Affected Business Service as a statistic type on the Pie Chart gadget.  This would add the capability to leverage ITSM related data in this dashboard gadget.
fields.summary: Add JSM ITSM fields (Team, Affected Business Service) fields as a statistic type on Pie Chart gadget

fields.description:
JWM Boards are constrained to use only 1 workflow within the project, whilst Jira SW allows for n:1 status mappings to swimlane and JQL.

As a JWM User, I want to be able to configure a JWM Board to map n:1 status' to a swimlane in Board view, as our business projects may have >1 workflow and issue type.
fields.summary: Allow Board swimlane configuration in JIRA Work Management

fields.description:
There should exist the possibility to turn off the suggestions about popular apps.

This could be considered as advertising and some users may not want to see them.

Also, it'll be good if a scroll bar could be added indicating the users can scroll for more apps. Having no bar has resulted in users either A. not being able to find what they were looking for or B. thinking the apps have been removed and they can no longer use them.

!image-2021-07-22-14-54-26-654.png|width=301,height=321!!AppMenu.png|width=231,height=321,thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add the possibility to remove popular add-ons section from the Apps menu and add a scroll bar to show more installed apps

fields.description:
At the moment, whenever we try to create a new project, the flow is:
 _Select Project Template -> Select Company managed or Team Managed -> Then the user can choose "Share settings with existing project"._

If someone is looking to create a project by sharing the existing setting, the above flow can be time consuming.

Please provide a way to quickly create projects which allows us to share the settings, with an existing project, without having to go through the above flow. For example a short cut key or a button on the navigation bar.
fields.summary: As a Jira administrator, I want the ability to quickly create a project by sharing the existing setting with another project.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently we are unable to add a value to the option list of a custom field from a next-gen project. 

 

[https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-custom-field-options/#api-rest-api-3-field-fieldid-context-contextid-option-put]

The endpoint requires a contextid which doesn't exist for next-gen custom fields. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to get contextid via REST API to create the call - no joy

h3. Expected Results

To be able to update the list of values for a next-gen custom field via REST API
h3. Actual Results

The call returns that the custom field can't be found.

h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Please allow adding a value to the custom field option list from next-gen custom fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Notification tab on iOS Mobile App ( Version 134.1) keep loading without complete successfully

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Notifications tab
 # Switch to another instance
 # Repeat it this a few times always switching to a new instance

h3. Expected Results
Notifications finish to load

h3. Actual Results
Notifications never finish to load

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

h3. Fix

The bug was fixed in Mobile App version 135.0.0 which was released in public on Jul 30, 2021 . 

https://apps.apple.com/us/app/jira-cloud-by-atlassian/id1006972087
fields.summary: Notifications tab on Mobile App stays forever loading without responding

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inline image attachments are not rendered correctly by Jira Global Email Handler
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send a email with an image in it's body
 # See the comment

h3. Expected Results

For the image to render correctly as it does when received my JSM handler 
 !Screenshot 2021-07-22 at 10.43.04.png|width=556,height=208!
h3. Actual Results

We see the markup instead of picture :/
 !Screenshot 2021-07-21 at 14.46.45.png|width=531,height=145!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inline image attachments are not rendered correctly by Jira Global Email Handler

fields.description:
Currently, Jira admins are unable to remove some of the features that they do not want their users to see on Company-managed projects. 

 For example, in the JWM Business project, the Forms feature is always visible to everyone who has access to the project and there is no way to hide or remove it. Which causes confusion to some users if they are not aware of how to utilize the feature.

(i) This feature is already available on the Team-managed projects where you can toggle it on or off for its features.

Please consider adding this feature to Company-managed projects for our customers.
fields.summary: Ability to add/remove features in Company-managed Projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When worklog is edited, the 'Time Remaining' calculated is not based on the (Original estimate-Time spent). The resulting 'Time Remaining' will be (Old 'Time Spent' value on the worklog-New 'Time Spent' value on worklog)
h3. Steps to Reproduce

(Assuming that 1d day is 8h)
 # Create a task ticket with *original estimate* is *2d*
 # Log work for *1h* => *time remaining* gets calculated as 1d *7h*
 # Continues to log work for *3d* (over log) => *time remaining* gets changed to *0m*
 # Now, Edit the last *time spent* value on the worklog from *3d* to *1h* => *time remaining* value gets updated to  *2d 7h*

But the expected *time remaining* is *1d* *6h*

[^Screen Recording 2021-07-21 at 9.55.31 PM.mov]
h3. Expected Results

 

The expected *time remaining* is *1d* *6h*
h3. Actual Results

The 'Time Remaining' value shown after editing the worklog is inconsistent when compared to the 'Original Estimation' and the 'Time spent' values.
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When worklog is edited, the 'Time Remaining' value should be calculated and updated based on 'Original estimate' and the 'Time spent' values.

fields.description:
Currently there is no French Canadian Language Pack available in Jira Cloud.

Is there a roadmap for this? Do you have translation documents that we can contribute to?

Thank you.
fields.summary: There is no French Canadian Language Pack for Jira Cloud

fields.description:
You should be able to place the field  "Original Estimate"  near "Time Remaining" within the Time tracking Tab on the issue's screen. 
Now, you only can place the field "Original Estimate" in the right-hand column
fields.summary: Original Estimate should be placable with the "Time Remaining" portion of Time Tracking.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to run an automation rule in a Team-managed Project for issues having restriction applied, it gives an error stating "_*Actor does not have permission to view one or more issues, or the issue was deleted (please check permissions and issue security levels)*_", in spite of the fact that actor is part of the restricted role. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Automation Rule 
 # Set the restriction for an issue type

!image-2021-07-21-17-43-24-144.png|width=732,height=160!

3. Execute the Automation rule for the same issue type with the actor part of the restricted role. 
h3. Expected Results

The rule should successfully run. 
h3. Actual Results

Automation rule fails with the permission error:

!image-2021-07-21-17-49-10-056.png|width=559,height=91!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automation Rule fails with permission error in Team-managed project for Issue Types with Restriction applied

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Team Managed projects on the board when editing an issue and Unassigned it after that  cant click on any other issues to be able to edit it
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On the Team Managed project board click on an issue to edit it
 # Unassigned the issue
 # Back on the board cant click on any issue on the board anymore

h3. Expected Results

To be able to edit other issues on the board
h3. Actual Results

Not be able to click on any issue and edit them
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page
fields.summary: Team Managed Board after editing to Unassigned the issue cant click on any other issues to be able to edit

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the new issue view, when a user clicks on the Fix Version field of an issue in full-page version, sometimes there is a delay of 3-4 seconds before the dropdown menu is shown. We've seen this case for Jira instance with thousands of options in their dropdown.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use a customer instance with thousands of options in their fix version field.
 # Open an issue. If you’re not viewing the full-page version of the issue, click the issue key to open it in full page.
 # Click on the Fix Version value field.

h3. Expected Results

Upon clicking the Fix Version's value field, the dropdown menu should show without observable delay so the user can select a fix version.
h3. Actual Results

Upon clicking the Fix Version's value field, the dropdown menu takes a couple of seconds delay before showing up.
h3. Workaround

No workaround available
fields.summary: Clicking on fix version field in the new issue view takes a long time before dropdown menu shows
